citation.article-title: Amycolatopsis sacchari sp. nov., a moderately thermophilic actinomycete isolated from vegetable matter
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Amycolatopsis sacchari sp. nov.
Amycolatopsis sacchari (sac'char.ri. M.L. n. Saccharum generic name of sugar cane; M.L. gen. n. sacchari of sugar cane)
Aerobic, non-motile, Gram-positive, non-acid-alcohol- fast, catalase-positive actinomycete which forms a branched substrate mycelium that fragments into rod-like elements.
The substrate mycelium carries moderate to abundant white aerial hyphae which differentiate into straight chains of spore-like structures on CYC agar.
Brown, orange or yellow irregular colonies with highly filamentous margins are formed on modified Bennett's agar.
Aesculin and urea are hydrolysed, hydrogen sulfide is formed from peptone and nitrate is reduced.
Most strains also hydrolyse allantoin; casein, elastin, gelatin, testosterone, Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80, L-tyrosine and xanthine are degraded but starch is not.

Acid is formed from adonitol, L-arabinose, D-cellobiose, dextrin, meso-erythritol, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-lactose, D-maltose, D-mannitol, α-methyl-D-glucoside, α-L-rhamnose, salicin, D-sucrose, D-trehalose and D-xylose, but not from meso-inositol, D-melibiose or D-sorbitol.

The organism cleaves 4-methylumbelliferone (4MU)-2-acetamido-2-deoxy-β-D-glucopyranoside, 4MU-N-acetyl-β-D-glucosaminide, 4MU-β-D-glucopyranoside, 4MU-heptanoate, 4MU-nonanoate, 4MU-palmitate, 4MU-phosphate (acid) and 4MU-β-D-xyloside, but not 4MU-α-L-arabinofuranoside, 4MU-β-D-fucopyranoside, 4MUβ-L-fucopyranoside, 4MU-α-D-galactopyranoside, 4MU-β-D-galactopyranoside or 4MU-β-D-glucuronide.

Similarly, all of the strains cleaved L-alanine-7 amino-methylcoumarin (7AMC), L-arginine-7AMC, benzyloxycarbonyl-L-arginine-L-arginine-7AMC, lcysteine-( benzyl)-7AMC, L-lysine-7AMC, L-methionine- 7AMC, benzyloxycarbonyL-phenylalanine, L-arginine-7AMC, L-tyrosine-7AMC and tertbutylocarbonyl- L-valine-L-proline-L-arginine-7AMC, but none attacked β-alanine-7AMC, L-aspartate- 7AMC, L-glutamate-7AMC, tert-butyloxycarbonylglutamyl- glycine-glycine-L-phenylalanine-7AMC, L-ornithine- 7AMC or L-pyroglutamate-7AMC.

Adonitol, D- and L-arabinose, D-cellobiose, dextrin, meso-erythritol, D-fructose, D- and L-fucose, D-galactose, gentiobiose, D-glycerol, glycogen, D-lactose, dmaltose, D-mannitol, D-mannose, α- and β-dmethylucoside, α-L-rhamnose, D-ribose, salicin, L-sorbose, D-sucrose, D-trehalose, xylitol and D-xylose (all at 1%, w/v) are used as sole carbon sources for energy and growth, but not amygdalin, arabitol, dulcitol, meso-inositol, D-melibiose, D-sorbitol or D-turanose.

Similarly, at 0.1% (w/v), growth was observed on L-alanine, androsterone, arbutin, butan-1-ol, ergosterol, ethanol, propan-1-ol, propan-2-ol, propylene glycol, protocatechuic acid, quinic acid, lserine, shikimic acid, sodium butyrate, sodium hippurate, sodium propionate, sodium pyruvate, sodium succinate, testosterone and L-tyrosine as sole carbon sources, but not on acetamide, benzamide, catechol, L-citrulline, p-cresol, m- or p-hydroxybenzoic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, D-mandelic acid, progesterol, sodium fumarate, sodium tartrate, squalene, syringealdehyde, trimethylamine or vanillin.
Growth occurs between pH 5 and 8 and between 20 and 45 °C, but not at 55 °C.

Growth also occurs in the presence of cephaloridine hydrochloride (250 μg ml-1), chloramphenicol (50 μg ml-1), demeclocycline hydrochloride (8 μg ml-1), gentamicin sulfate (5 μg ml-1), kanamycin sulfate (5 μg ml-1), lincomycin hydrochloride (10 μg ml-1), neomycin sulfate (10 μg ml-1), oleandomycin phosphate (2 μg ml-1), penicillin G (20 μg ml-1), polymyxin b sulfate (50 μg ml-1), rifampicin (2 μg ml-1), streptomycin sulfate (16 μg ml-1), tobramycin sulfate (8 μg ml-1) and vancomycin hydrochloride (0±25 μg ml-1), but not in the presence of kanamycin sulfate (50 μg ml-1) or tetracycline hydrochloride (5 μg ml-1).

The organism is resistant to bismuth citrate (10 μg ml-1), crystal violet (1 μg ml-1), phenol (100 μg ml-1), phenyl ethanol (4000 μg ml-1), potassium tellurite (10 μg ml-1), sodium azide (10 μg ml-1), sodium chloride (7%, w/v), teepol (100 μg ml-1), tetrazolium (100 μg ml-1) and thallous acetate (10 μg ml-1) but is sensitive to bismuth citrate (100 μg ml-1), crystal violet (10 μg ml-1), sodium chloride (10%, w/v), tetrazolium (1000 μg ml-1) and thallous acetate (100 μg ml-1).
The type strain, K24T (DSM 44468T=KCTC 9863T), exhibits all of the properties cited above.
Isolated from sugar cane bagasse and from floor dust of a hemp factory.
